sub_topic: Finding the Tutte polynomial of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph G shown below, find the Tutte polynomial of the graph G.

```
          a------b       
          |      |         
          |      |         
          d------c  
```

Hint: Use the formula of Tutte polynomial to calculate the polynomial of the given graph.
message_2:
To find the Tutte polynomial of the given graph G, we can use the recursive formula:

T(G) = T(G\e) + T(G/e) if e is a non-loop, non-bridge edge
T(G) = (x-1)T(G\e) if e is a bridge
T(G) = (y-1)T(G-e) if e is a loop

Here, G\e denotes the graph obtained by deleting the edge e, and G/e denotes the graph obtained by contracting the edge e.

In the given graph G, there are no loops, and all edges are non-bridge edges. We can choose any edge, say edge ab, and apply the recursive formula:

T(G) = T(G\ab) + T(G/ab)

G\ab is the graph obtained by deleting edge ab, which is:

```
          a      b       
          |      |         
          |      |         
          d------c  
```

G/ab is the graph obtained by contracting edge ab, which is:

```
          a,b
          |         
          |         
          d------c  
```

Now, we can apply the recursive formula to both G\ab and G/ab.

For G\ab, we can choose edge dc:

T(G\ab) = T(G\ab\dc) + T(G\ab/dc)

G\ab\dc is the graph obtained by deleting edge dc:

```
          a      b       
          |      |         
          |      |         
          d      c  
```

G\ab/dc is the graph obtained by contracting edge dc:

```
          a      b       
          |      |         
          |      |         
          d,c
```

Both G\ab\dc and G\ab/dc are trees, so their Tutte polynomials are x^(n-1)y^(m-n) where n is the number of vertices and m is the number of edges:

T(G\ab\dc) = x^(4-1)y^(3-4) = x^3y^(-1)
T(G\ab/dc) = x^(3-1)y^(2-3) = x^2y^(-1)

For G/ab, we can choose edge dc:

T(G/ab) = T(G/ab\dc) + T(G/ab/dc)

G/ab\dc is the graph obtained by deleting edge dc:

```
          a,b
          |         
          |         
          d      c  
```

G/ab/dc is the graph obtained by contracting edge dc:

```
          a,b
          |         
          |         
          d,c
```

Both G/ab\dc and G/ab/dc are trees:

T(G/ab\dc) = x^(3-1)y^(2-3) = x^2y^(-1)
T(G/ab/dc) = x^(2-1)y^(1-2) = xy^(-1)

Now, we can combine the results:

T(G) = T(G\ab) + T(G/ab) = (T(G\ab\dc) + T(G\ab/dc)) + (T(G/ab\dc) + T(G/ab/dc))
T(G) = (x^3y^(-1) + x^2y^(-1)) + (x^2y^(-1) + xy^(-1))
T(G) = x^3y^(-1) + 2x^2y^(-1) + xy^(-1)

So, the Tutte polynomial of the given graph G is:

T(G) = x^3y^(-1) + 2x^2y^(-1) + xy^(-1)
